text:
Browse powerful Beats Solo Pro with noise reduction. This is the sound
05 Nov 2019, 10:00 by Nikita Goryainov
What do the Beats represent for you?
You can not answer, because all this is not relevant. After the excellent Powerbeats Pro and, now, Solo Pro, my opinion about the sound of the brand's headphones has finally turned for the better.
The new generation of the most popular overhead ‚Äúears‚Äù brought a lot of cool innovations. Among them are the noise suppressor, a new decent design and the Lightning port, dear to us all. All this works up to 40 hours on a single charge and connects to an iPhone incredibly easily.
From awesome sound to new chips, Solo Pro is full of advantages. But this does not mean that I recommend them to everyone. There are several contentious issues. Including about them I will tell in the review further.
Briefly about the main thing. Compare with Beats Solo3 Wireless



The Pro in the Solo title promises major improvements after the almost popular Solo3 Wireless. I decided to turn their enumeration into something like a mini-review. Maybe you read all the laziness. Then this block is enough.
So what has changed for the better:
–î–∏–∑–∞–π–Ω the design was updated: goodbye, glossy plastic‚ñ∏ the body and headband became stronger, stronger‚ñ∏ an active noise reduction system appeared‚ñ∏ a new wireless chip: there was W1, became H1‚ñ∏ the sound distribution function on supported iPhones and iPads Sir Siri automatically responded to voice requests‚ñ∏ charging via port Lightning instead of micro-USB‚ñ∏ improved sound, and significantly
There are several controversial points:
‚ñπ there is no longer a 3.5 mm audio port ‚ñπ noise reduction time (22 h) is almost half that without it (40 h) ‚ñπ if Solo3 Wireless seemed uncomfortable, then Solo Pro will not work either
Now Solo3 Wireless can be bought for 15 900 rubles, and Solo Pro costs 21 990 rubles.


Options Beats Solo Pro: a cover from recycled materials, a Lightning cable to USB-A, a carbine for attaching the cover, Beats stickers in two colors and instructions.

In my opinion, the price difference is justified by the improvement in sound quality and noise reduction function. If you are interested in the headphones of the Solo series, it is better to immediately look towards the Pro. At the same time, if you did not like Solo3 in fit, design or construction, then the new model is hardly suitable.
Now forward, discuss in detail.
Design and management. Stylish, sturdy and without touch panels



I always liked the design of the wired Beats EP (6190 rubles, our review), because they did not have glossy plastic. Headphones looked trite more expensive than ordinary Solo, and the relative abundance of metal only exacerbated this impression.
Therefore, I am glad that Solo Pro went to the same steppe: matte, slightly textured plastic cups interspersed with steel inserts. It‚Äôs definitely better than Solo3 Wireless, which against their background looks like a toy, and in the hands it feels the same.
From Beats EP, the novelty also got a landing height adjustment mechanism. There used to be a telescopic system, a little flimsy. Now the headphones are simply pulled out of the recesses in the headband, along with a steel mount.
Appearance Solo Pro to my liking. Headphones finally look universally good on any person, a touch of youth and simplicity has disappeared. Nobody will miss the old glossy plastic.



There is only one noticeable button on the case, located next to the Lightning port. If you think that it includes headphones, then you are mistaken - this is a change in the noise reduction mode.
How then to control playback? Very simple: five keys in the format of the navigation panel are hidden in the round cover of the right earphone. These are physical buttons, no sensors (triple cheers).
Press up and down - adjust the volume, left-right change tracks, and by clicking on the Beats logo, stop or start playback. If you hold down the center logo key, Siri turns on. Tactile feedback is clear and noticeable, so that on the go and blindly everything will turn out without problems.
The lack of a power button is explained simply. Solo Pro turns on when you lay them out. And turn off when at least one of the two headphones is in the folded state. Not the most obvious system, but you get used to it quickly. The main thing is not to forget to do it.
Comfort fit and wear. May be a little tight



Beats reported that they redesigned the embouchure, but subjectively, I did not notice the difference. They are voluminous and puffy again, covered with leatherette and filled with soft foam inside. The speakers are covered by an acoustic grid.
These are still on-ear headphones - adjacent to the ears, but not covering them like a dome.
The speakers themselves deviate freely along the axis from the mount, fixing on the ears even at an angle. The height is freely adjustable, but its margin is small, up to 4 centimeters on each side.
The inside of the headband is soft, the headphones do not press on the head. Outside it is plastic, single-segment and slightly prone to bending. Without fanaticism, you can‚Äôt spiral into a spiral, but you won‚Äôt accidentally break it.
You can describe the landing of Solo Pro in one word: tight. They are very tight to the head, pressing their ears. On the one hand, this increases passive sound insulation, including external. People will not be reluctant to listen to your playlist.



On the other hand, tightly in this case also means tight. Alas, I was not a fan of landing all previous generations of Beats Solo. This is a personal moment, each has a different shape of the head and ears. But Solo Pro, personally, I can‚Äôt wear for more than three hours without discomfort.
Ears get warm, begin to ache. You can remove it for half an hour, then continue, it will become easier. I talked with the owners of Solo3 Wireless, and they say that over time the headphones wear out, it becomes much easier to wear. Pressure on the ears decreases. So this moment, apparently, is resolved over time.
I also noticed that not everyone can wear these headphones on the neck. They will be like a second scarf in winter, well, or a choker (sorry).
I suspect that children and adolescents will not have such problems. But still I want to warn you, regardless of age: you need to hold Solo Pro on your ears for at least five minutes before buying. And if you have a really big head, then Solo Pro, IMHO, will not work at all.
Iron and noise reduction. Listen, hear and even eavesdrop



Solo Pro has improved the technical side, and very seriously. In addition to the H1 chip with all the advanced features for the iOS ecosystem, Beats has seriously boosted the headphone processor. Yes, it is the processor.
Now the headphones support active noise reduction, and with it the transparency mode. Shumodav works in both directions: cuts off not only external sounds, but also monitors the tightness of the ear pads, turns of the head and even the shape of your ears.
Solo Pro adjusts the sound a hundred times per second based on all these factors, and in this they are suspiciously similar to AirPods Pro. I won‚Äôt be surprised if they have the same processors.



I‚Äôll evaluate the quality of noise reduction: about half the noise is cut off, the effect is noticeable instantly. It does not reach the leaders in this field in terms of power, but it really improves the experience of music in the subway, train, car or plane.
Audifilov warn that the noise reduction here affects the sound, reducing the power of the bass. It‚Äôs not critical, but it‚Äôs useful to know in order to turn off the feature more willingly in a calm environment for maximum enjoyment of music.
Active noise canceling does not negatively affect me. But I know many people who start to get sick or dizzy from such a chip (not specifically in Solo Pro, but in general). So I advise you to check live on yourself.



The transparency mode allows you to hear the surroundings without having to remove your headphones or pause music. At the same time, the noise reduction does not turn off completely: the hum of the plane and the crack of the subway car are still muffled. This is a useful feature that allows you to always be on the lookout for everything that happens on the street. With her, even eavesdrop on others on the street.
Again, AirPods Pro function in a similar way in the mode of the same name (they are even called the same in the iOS settings), which indirectly confirms the theory about similar hardware in these two devices.
You can control the noise reduction modes both through the iOS settings (Bluetooth menu), and through the physical button next to the Lightning port. Changing the mode by key is accompanied by a musical effect, but it is not obvious. Either turned on the noise cutter, or turned it off, it's not entirely clear. I would prefer a verbal announcement to him.
It‚Äôs a pity that you can‚Äôt change the power of the noise reduction or transparency mode. You either turn it on to the maximum, or turn it off completely. Some slider would not hurt.



Well, the last two points. Firstly, the Solo Pro updated the microphone system, they better transmit voice during a conversation. I willingly believe, because even on the noisy Tverskaya there was no need to scream or try to cover myself with a palm so that the interlocutor could hear my speech.
And secondly, charging now goes through the Lightning port. A cable (black!) Is included. There used to be micro-USB, which is hopelessly outdated, tired and generally well of it.
As the owner of the Apple fleet, the transition to Lightning completely suits me. Maybe in a couple of years they will switch to USB-C, it will be perfect in general.
There is only one minus. The advent of Lightning means the disappearance of a 3.5mm audio jack. Solo Pro can only connect wired sound sources via a 3.5 mm cable to Lightning. Which is not included and which costs 3 thousand rubles.
Could and put.
Sound. The beats are not the same anymore and that's very good



Year after year, the company fights criticism from the audiophile camp in the only true way - improving sound quality. Solo Pro is no exception in this regard. Moreover, these are clearly the best sound quality headphones Beats has ever produced.
An advanced driver with optimized aperture geometry creates a high frequency response with less overall harmonic distortion.
It was a quote from a press release, I put it as it is. It is objectively clear that the sound quality is improved here, but how much?
The difference with Solo3 Wireless is noticeable instantly, just from the first seconds. Everything, the echo and bass quality ceased to be a hallmark of Solo. I finally hear the mid frequencies in them:¬†vibrant, vibrant and vibrant.



Partial normalization of the frequency response (without fanaticism, it's still Beats) unexpectedly makes the Solo Pro almost omnivorous. There is no longer a feeling that the voices seemed to be cut off from above.
However, the new Solo do not enter the clearing of audiophilia. The rhythm, the power of the bass is still becoming a key part of any track, if it is initially rich in low frequencies. Just the emphasis on them is now a little shifted, and this has significantly changed the sound of the headphones as a whole.
In this model, an unusually strong midbass. If the bass starts to play, it seems to be on the same level with the rest of the instruments, enveloping the music with rhythm and drive, usually invisible in wireless headphones. And techno, trance, electronics in general explode consciousness even at low volume.
I drove a selection of jazz tracks on the first impression and I have to admit - in Solo Pro they sound very driving and at the same time decently, as if it should be so. Pops is completely ideal, especially modern, rich in low frequencies of all stripes.



The vocals are juicy, not depressed, although slightly pressed to the center. The sound stage is not very wide, the ultra-dense landing of the headphones affects.
The only genre in which ears stumbled even a little was heavy metal. Well, very heavy and fast, with a focus on guitars. Against it plays too lively bass, and especially the midbass, flooding everything else in the track. I can‚Äôt imagine the burnt metalhead in the Beats, so there is little loss.
I can confidently say that Solo Pro sounds profitable against the background of most wireless headphones. Before us is the ideal development of the Beats sound philosophy: there should be bass, and there should be a lot of it. Just now, the principle is achieved without tonal degradation of all other frequencies. And this cannot but rejoice.
This makes me even more offended that I can not wear Solo Pro for a long time. I hope they stretch over time. Because such a sound is contagious, after it it is just sickening to listen to your home ‚Äúmonitors‚Äù.
Where to buy and what colors I recommend



Beats Solo Pro is an excellent update for the Solo line for fans of previous models, as well as for those who used to bypass Beats. Seriously, people, you put them on first and listen. This is no longer a bass machine, but very decent headphones for sound quality. Many competitors sound even worse for these 22 thousand rubles.
Yes, this is not an audiophile story. Yes, wearing comfort is highly dependent on the shape and size of the head. But the rest was a decent thing.
Full integration into the Apple ecosystem, useful noise reduction features and decent battery life are seasoned with the brand's undeniable popularity. Wearing Beats is no longer a shame, even if you are bearded, gloomy and harsh.
In short, this is a good choice for those who need universal large earphones for Mac, iPhone and Apple Watch at the same time. Two tapas, no Bluetooth menus. With the H1 chip is very convenient.



Sales of Beats Solo Pro begin on November 8, now you can pre-order. They cost 21,990 rubles.
All six colors will be sold in Russia, of which I recommend gray, white and dark blue. The rest is not for boring people, especially bright red.
I have an ivory model in the photo (white). She is pretty, IMHO, second place in front of sulfur. But gray in fact is beige, and no matter how you look at it, it looks just super. I advise you to look at her first.
